description: Ms. composite codex. Title of first text from fol. 1a, by a later hand; title of second text from fol. 54a. On front cover: Label reading "284" in Arabic script. Ms. erroneously foliated beginning on first flyleaf. Record follows erroneous foliation. Physical description: 15-16 lines per page; written in casual nastaʻliq by two different hands in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Some damp staining; edges somewhat ragged. Origin: First text completed Ramaḍān 935 H [May-June 1529] by Muḥammad Ḥusayn al-Ḥasanī (fol. 53a). Second text completed on Wednesday, 7 Rabīʻ II 681 H [15 July 1282] (fol. 130a).
author: Ṭūsī, Naṣīr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1201-1274
abstract: Two texts on astrology and astronomy by Naṣīr al-Dīn al-Ṭūsī.
contents: 2. fol. 54a-130a: Risālah-i Muʻīnīyah dar ʻilm-i hayʾat. Manual of astronomy dedicated to Muʻīn al-Dīn Abū al-Shams, son of the author's patron Nāṣir al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Abī Manṣūr (governor of Quhistan). Missing first page; with numerous diagrams.
extent: 128 leaves : paper, ill. ; 191 x 119 (147 x 77-85) bound to 191 x 125 mm.
title: [Hāz̲ā Kitāb-i Nujūm-i Baṭlamyūs] ; Risālah-i Muʻīnīyah dar ʻilm-i hayʾat.
provenance: The date 1357 is noted in conjunction with the title of the first text as given on fol. 1a.
creator: طوسى، نصىر الدىن محمد بن محمد، 1201-1274
subject: Ptolemy, active 2nd century—Centiloquium. Arabic
binding_note: Limp dark brown leather with blind-stamped fillets; water damaged.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
